text:
This is on ANT Alpha1.5 (Apr-16-2002 nightly)

ejbc complaints of missing classes when compiling the generic-jar
created by <ejbjar>. The missing classes are the return values of some of
the methods in the bean.
If I revert back to an older version of ANT Alpha1.5 it works fine. 

I am not specifying the "dependencies" attribute, hence I was expecting the 
code to work as before.
creator: j_a_fernandez@yahoo.com
conor@apache.org
text:
Please test with 1.4.1 and let me know if it works with that release and not the
current 1.5 from CVS. 

We do not offer backward compatability with previous alpha versions, only
previous releases. In fact, the behaviour of ejbjar was changed to bring the
default behaviour into line with that of 1.4.1 for backward compatability
reasons. If you want the enhanced dependency gathering, you must set the
dependency attribute.
